SEARCH
Module iu.util.auth
Package edu.iu.auth.oidc

Interface IuOpenIdClient

public interface IuOpenIdClient
Provides client application metadata for configuring the OpenID client module iu.util.auth.oidc. To be implemented by an application-level web request handler.

Only one OAuth authorization client configuration can be configured per OpenID provider. It is expected but optional for implementations to be context-senstive.

  • Method Details

    • getTrustRefreshInterval

      Duration getTrustRefreshInterval()
      Gets the maximum time to retain provider trusted keys before attempting to refresh.

      Once keys have been read successfully at least once, the last known good version will be returned in the event of an error.

      Returns:
      Duration

    • getAuthenticationTimeout

      Duration getAuthenticationTimeout()
      Gets the maximum length of time to allow for authentication, including interactions between the user agent and authorization server.
      Returns:
      Duration

    • getAuthenticatedSessionTimeout

      Duration getAuthenticatedSessionTimeout()
      Gets the maximum length of time to allow an authenticated session, as timed by the auth_time OIDC claim, to be remain active before requesting the provide re-establish credentials for the principal.
      Returns:
      Duration, will be truncated to seconds

    • getActivationInterval

      Duration getActivationInterval()
      Gets the maximum length of time to assume a prior activation to be repeatable, typically measured in seconds. Once this interval is passed, activation will be confirmed by sending session-bound access tokens to a downstream verification API.
      Returns:
      Duration, will be truncated to milliseconds

    • getResourceUri

      URI getResourceUri()
      Gets the root resource URI covered by this client's protection domain.

      All client-side application URIs used in this client's context must be rooted at this URI. The URI may be opaque and/or not absolute if protecting only a single domain. Resource URIs may use the java: URI scheme for environments that have JNDI configured.

      Returns:
      URI

    • getRedirectUri

      URI getRedirectUri()
      Gets the redirect URI for use with authorization code flow.
      Returns:
      redirect URI; null if authorization code is not supported for the authentication realm.

    • getCredentials

      IuApiCredentials getCredentials()
      Gets the client's API credentials.
      Returns:
      IuApiCredentials

    • activate

      void activate(IuApiCredentials credentials) throws IuAuthenticationException, edu.iu.IuBadRequestException, edu.iu.IuAuthorizationFailedException, edu.iu.IuOutOfServiceException, IllegalStateException
      Revalidates verified credentials as not expired, not revoked, and not prohibited by an environment restriction specified by the application realm or authentication provider, as a condition for session activation.
      Parameters:
      credentials - credentials to revalidate
      Throws:
      IuAuthenticationException - If the credentials are invalid (i.e., expired or revoked) for the authentication realm and the user or remote client must reauthenticate before a session may be activated.
      edu.iu.IuBadRequestException - If the credentials are malformed or not understood.
      edu.iu.IuAuthorizationFailedException - If access has been revoked since since initial authorization.
      edu.iu.IuOutOfServiceException - If credentials and authorization are still valid but access should be denied due to an environment restriction.
      IllegalStateException - If an unrecoverable error occurs, e.g., communicating with an authentication provider

    • getIdTokenSignedResponseAlg

      default String getIdTokenSignedResponseAlg()
      Gets the expected algorithm for token response signature.
      Returns:
      JWT signature algorithm to expect in the alg claim

    • getScope

      default Iterable<String> getScope()
      Gets the requested authorization scope.

      Should not include openid.

      Returns:
      request authorization scope

    • getAuthorizationCodeAttributes

      default Map<String,String> getAuthorizationCodeAttributes()
      Get additional attributes to pass to the authorization endpoint when initiating authorization code flow.

      It is not required for repeat invocation to return the same attributes. An authorization session will invoke this method once when initiating authorization code flow, and retain those attributes throughout the flow.

      Must not include any standard attributes defined by OAuth 2.0 or OIDC Core 1.0 for authorization code flow.

      Returns:
      Map of additional authorization code attributes; may be null or empty if authorization code flow is not supported or additional attributes are not required for token verification.

    • getClientCredentialsAttributes

      default Map<String,String> getClientCredentialsAttributes()
      Get additional attributes to pass to the token endpoint when initiating client credentials code flow.

      Must not include any standard attributes defined by OAuth 2.0 or OIDC Core 1.0 for authorization code flow.

      Returns:
      Map of additional client credentials attributes; may be null or empty if not required for establishing client credentials.

    • revoke

      default void revoke(IuApiCredentials credentials)
      Revokes credentials established for use with the client's authentication realm, if supported.
      Parameters:
      credentials - credentials to revoke
